page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO MITCHELDEAN
page.content: The{Mitcheldean area}lies at the north eastern end of the{Forest of {Dean.}The area is remarkable for the variety of its{landscape and natural {environment,}which is due to the nature of the underlying{geological {formations.}The extent to which these factors have influenced both the historical and present day geography make the area a classic one for{ {field studies.} Other notable features include the large{Rank Xerox office machinery {plant at Mitcheldean,}which is the areas main employer. Local authorities are the Forest of Dean District Council and Gloucestershire County Council.
